rawMarkdown:
---
source: https://developer.apple.com/documentation/Combine/Subscriber
crawled: 2025-12-09T22:26:15Z
---

# Subscriber

**Protocol**

A protocol that declares a type that can receive input from a publisher.

## Declaration

```swift
protocol Subscriber<Input, Failure> : CustomCombineIdentifierConvertible
```

## Overview

A [doc://com.apple.Combine/documentation/Combine/Subscriber] instance receives a stream of elements from a [doc://com.apple.Combine/documentation/Combine/Publisher], along with life cycle events describing changes to their relationship. A given subscriber’s [doc://com.apple.Combine/documentation/Combine/Subscriber/Input] and [doc://com.apple.Combine/documentation/Combine/Subscriber/Failure] associated types must match the [doc://com.apple.Combine/documentation/Combine/Publisher/Output] and [doc://com.apple.Combine/documentation/Combine/Publisher/Failure] of its corresponding publisher.

You connect a subscriber to a publisher by calling the publisher’s [doc://com.apple.Combine/documentation/Combine/Publisher/subscribe(_:)-4u8kn] method.  After making this call, the publisher invokes the subscriber’s [doc://com.apple.Combine/documentation/Combine/Subscriber/receive(subscription:)] method. This gives the subscriber a [doc://com.apple.Combine/documentation/Combine/Subscription] instance, which it uses to demand elements from the publisher, and to optionally cancel the subscription. After the subscriber makes an initial demand, the publisher calls [doc://com.apple.Combine/documentation/Combine/Subscriber/receive(_:)], possibly asynchronously, to deliver newly-published elements. If the publisher stops publishing, it calls [doc://com.apple.Combine/documentation/Combine/Subscriber/receive(completion:)], using a parameter of type [doc://com.apple.Combine/documentation/Combine/Subscribers/Completion] to indicate whether publishing completes normally or with an error.

Combine provides the following subscribers as operators on the [doc://com.apple.Combine/documentation/Combine/Publisher] type:

- [doc://com.apple.Combine/documentation/Combine/Publisher/sink(receiveCompletion:receiveValue:)] executes arbitrary closures when it receives a completion signal and each time it receives a new element.
- [doc://com.apple.Combine/documentation/Combine/Publisher/assign(to:on:)] writes each newly-received value to a property identified by a key path on a given instance.

## Declaring supporting types

- **Input**: The kind of values this subscriber receives.
- **Failure**: The kind of errors this subscriber might receive.

## Receiving elements

- **receive(_:)**: Tells the subscriber that the publisher has produced an element.
- **receive()**: Tells the subscriber that a publisher of void elements is ready to receive further requests.

## Receiving life cycle events

- **receive(subscription:)**: Tells the subscriber that it has successfully subscribed to the publisher and may request items.
- **receive(completion:)**: Tells the subscriber that the publisher has completed publishing, either normally or with an error.
- **Subscribers.Completion**: A signal that a publisher doesn’t produce additional elements, either due to normal completion or an error.

## Subscribers

- **Processing Published Elements with Subscribers**: Apply back pressure to precisely control when publishers produce elements.
- **Subscribers**: A namespace for types that serve as subscribers.
- **AnySubscriber**: A type-erasing subscriber.
- **Subscription**: A protocol representing the connection of a subscriber to a publisher.
- **Subscriptions**: A namespace for symbols related to subscriptions.

## Inherits From

- CustomCombineIdentifierConvertible

## Conforming Types

- AnySubscriber
- Subscribers.Assign
- Subscribers.Sink
